description: nova.tests.__init__.py:setup() creates a network. This makes our tests hard to understand, because there's no way to tell if that network really is needed for the tests to succeed or not. I tried commenting it out and running the test suite. Only 15 failures. That's 0.7%. Certainly not enough to justify having this a "mystery guest" in every other test case.
title: nova.tests.setup() shouldn't create a network
